title: Fred Herzog, photographer whose pioneering colour images brought Vancouver of the 1950s and 1960s to life – obituary
text:
Fred Herzog, who has died aged 88, was a pioneer of colour photography celebrated for his shots of Vancouver in the 1950s and 1960s.

A German émigré, Herzog saw his adoptive city in a vibrant light. He brought a colourist’s sensibility and an outsider’s eye to what was popularly known as “old Vancouver” – the ramshackle downtown districts, Chinatown, the theatre district and the docks – lively neighbourhoods reshaped by the wrecking ball.
